page.title: 12The Forestry Commission.
page.content: Within the area the Forestry Commission follows a fairly strict routine of conservation over the large areas of woodland. The trees within the area are a mixture of hard and soft woods, but are mainly beech,oak, ash and some pine. Most of the plantations are open to the public, with car parks and picnic areas to encourage people to use the forests. They also ensure that the game,such as deer, is protected,so dogs on leads are allowed,but are not encouraged to run free. They also protect all wildlife and ensure that pheasants are not interferred with and that poachers are actively discouraged! They work in close cooperation with the local farmers,so that trees on farm land are equally conserved with those on the plantations.
